item.title: 325 – Blessing (Thief)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blessing (Thief) O God be the thief. Break in. Steal all I control. Stab me in my reaching hand. Burn down this  house I’ll never own. Take ease & piety. Bring ashes. But O God don’t. Please. Just leave me … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Blessing (Thief)

O God
be

the thief.
Break in.

Steal all
I control.

Stab me
in my reaching hand.

Burn down
this  house

I’ll never
own.

Take ease
& piety.

Bring
ashes.

But O
God

don’t.
Please.

Just leave
me be.

item.title: 324 – Blessing (Eating At the Table of Small Graces)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blessing (Eating At the Table of Small Graces) Joshua’s eggs left by, his cup. He’s off to be a father soon. I eat up the yellow that’s left, clean the plate and fork, rinse the cup. The kitchen is slabs … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Blessing (Eating At the Table of Small Graces)

Joshua’s eggs left by, his cup. He’s off
to be a father soon. I eat up the yellow
that’s left, clean the plate and fork,
rinse the cup. The kitchen is slabs
of light. I touch the bloody feet of Christ
nailed over the door, zip my heavy coat.
Every breath is colder. Weather has turned
around a wooden post, like wire, barbed
and full of metal. The garden hose sleeps
in a pile on the porch. Three boys and a girl
walk by, a lurching animal, hunting what
I can’t see. This will all freeze. Tonight
the pipes will burst at the Baptist church.
We’ll wake to everything we’ve known
encased, cut at odd angles, throwing light
like stones. A frozen lake in the street.
Tracks in the weeds. A robin on the doorstep.
Power lines creak in glittering cases.
The hens all gathered in. The world waiting
for the right moment to shatter and groan.

item.title: 323 – Wyoming Sky (fragment)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Wyoming Sky (fragment) Sharp breath Metal barbs Sullied stars Taste of iron Wyoming sky
item.content:encoded:
Wyoming Sky (fragment)

Sharp breath
Metal barbs
Sullied stars
Taste of iron
Wyoming sky

item.title: 322 – Blessing (Doubt)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blessing (Doubt) Take this hand to your lips kiss-whistle across its emptiness Your own song of want and sorrow your tongue touching the haggard edge of All that is Real salted iron blood taste it and know that I Am Peer out the … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Blessing (Doubt)

Take this hand to your lips
kiss-whistle across its emptiness
Your own song of want
and sorrow your tongue touching
the haggard edge of All that is
Real salted iron blood
taste it and know that I Am

Peer out the ragged eye
A thousand camels pass through
Linger the long knowing
of your touch, each finger held
in the absence test the depth of All
you’ve never and always known

item.title: 321 – Blessing (Odd Bod)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blessing (Odd Bod) the body’s odd manners: fits and starts palsied shake and hammer all knees and back-bent nelbows on pointe stiffened liquid lines scrangling around on hands and feet an upright ship upended where’s the anchor anymore? ask the … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Blessing (Odd Bod)

the body’s odd manners: fits
and starts palsied shake and hammer
all knees and back-bent nelbows
on pointe stiffened liquid lines
scrangling around on hands
and feet an upright ship upended
where’s the anchor anymore? ask
the ghost in the machine making
each eye blink independent circle
lips into kiss the cheekbone forehead
circled lips of the other bow-bent
body ghost making it do what it wants
rampant at the tiller running against the wind
what it ought or ought not to do
how did the ghost get in there
anyway how will the ghost get out?

item.title: 320 – Blessing (Blind)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blessing (Blind) I speak of thee with blind tongue empty echoing head voice of no knowing who was and is and is to come I hold open empty hands full of wind wheat chaff dust I am wholly open to what is and … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Blessing (Blind)

I speak of thee
with blind tongue
empty echoing head
voice of no knowing
who was and is
and is to come
I hold open empty
hands full of wind
wheat chaff dust
I am wholly open to
what is and was
is to come again
when? I speak
of thee I know not
of what I speak
to hear you your wind
in my voice of no knowing
still knowing more
inside my blindness

item.title: 319 – Blessing (Flight)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: 319 – Blessing (Flight) God-given right of birds taken by man to subdue all earth and sky Holy the firm ground kissed of penitents bearing again heavy loads
item.content:encoded:
319 – Blessing (Flight)

God-given
right of birds
taken by man
to subdue all
earth and sky

Holy the firm
ground kissed
of penitents
bearing again
heavy loads

item.title: 318 – Blessing (Tools)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blessing (Tools) How badly did Christ cut his hands? How true the square of his first chairs? Joseph’s worn tools–hammer, tongs, saw and plane–graceless extensions of his body. Heavy expectation hewed to wisdom of haggard scars, give of wood, loss of not a little blood. … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Blessing (Tools)

How badly did Christ cut his hands?
How true the square of his first chairs?
Joseph’s worn tools–hammer, tongs,
saw and plane–graceless extensions
of his body. Heavy expectation hewed
to wisdom of haggard scars, give of wood,
loss of not a little blood. The world’s sharp
reminders smoothed. The begotten tools taken
to hand in time, curves and unseen angles
known by feel, unthought as breathing, bodily
as wine and bread.

item.title: 317 – Blessing (Snow)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blessing (Snow) First fall silent nearly: quiet crinkle sliding down down jackets deer jays titmice all betrayed to hungry coyote every evil made and covered dead weeds busted cars slash piles gone under  lie down in the white sweep out … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Blessing (Snow)

First fall silent
nearly: quiet crinkle
sliding down down jackets

deer jays titmice
all betrayed
to hungry coyote

every evil made and covered
dead weeds busted cars
slash piles gone under 

lie down in the white
sweep out wide-winged angels
against the threat hidden

in each flake cut diamond
no two alike all the same
falling falling falling

item.title: 316 – Blessing (Winter)
item.dc:creator: Graham
item.description: Blessing (Winter) It is the time for snow On street-parked cars And the shoulders Of mountains time Of sharp-angled sun Low in the sky of apples Carrots parsnips crisp The time of Thanks And Feast of early dark Of corded … Continue reading →
item.content:encoded:
Blessing (Winter)

It is the time for snow
On street-parked cars
And the shoulders
Of mountains time
Of sharp-angled sun
Low in the sky of apples
Carrots parsnips crisp
The time of Thanks
And Feast of early dark
Of corded wood of sap
And juniper smoke of gin
Soaked berries and drunk
Jays fighting themselves
In the pickup’s mirrors
Of Rabbit’s warren and
Bear’s disappearance
It is the time of late stars early
Of long-standing moon
Of thick candles barleywine
And whiskied nights of stories
Woven strong of sleep over all
It is the time of dreams
